bug.author: amarrella
bug.summary: Kubeflow on EKS not starting jupyter notebooks
bug.description:
Hello, I'm playing around with a Kubeflow installation on EKS following the instructions in <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/</denchmark-link>
Everything seems to work fine, but when I try to start a jupyter notebook server and i click "SPAWN" the request returns a 500. Checking the logs in the jupyter-web-app pod I see the following: <denchmark-code>[2019-05-22 15:31:20,934] ERROR in app: Exception on /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks [POST] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 2292, in wsgi_app response = self.full_dispatch_request() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 1815, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.handle_user_exception(e) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 1718, in handle_user_exception reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/_compat.py", line 35, in reraise raise value File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 1813, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.dispatch_request() File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 1799, in dispatch_request return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args) File "/app/kubeflow_jupyter/default/app.py", line 40, in post_notebook poddefaultLabels = api.get_poddefaults_labels(namespace) File "/app/kubeflow_jupyter/common/api.py", line 123, in get_poddefaults_labels ns, "poddefaults")['items'] File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/kubernetes/client/apis/custom_objects_api.py", line 1432, in list_namespaced_custom_object (data) = self.list_namespaced_custom_object_with_http_info(group, version, namespace, plural, **kwargs) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/kubernetes/client/apis/custom_objects_api.py", line 1538, in list_namespaced_custom_object_with_http_info collection_formats=collection_formats) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/kubernetes/client/api_client.py", line 321, in call_api _return_http_data_only, collection_formats, _preload_content, _request_timeout) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/kubernetes/client/api_client.py", line 155, in __call_api _request_timeout=_request_timeout) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/kubernetes/client/api_client.py", line 342, in request headers=headers) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/kubernetes/client/rest.py", line 231, in GET query_params=query_params) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/kubernetes/client/rest.py", line 222, in request raise ApiException(http_resp=r) kubernetes.client.rest.ApiException: (404) Reason: Not Found HTTP response headers: HTTPHeaderDict({'Audit-Id': 'db5efa14-8ccd-4921-a2ac-8c885afe154b', 'Content-Type': 'text/plain; charset=utf-8', 'X-Content-Type-Options': 'nosniff', 'Date': 'Wed, 22 May 2019 15:31:20 GMT', 'Content-Length': '19'}) HTTP response body: 404 page not found </denchmark-code>
So to me it seems it's trying to hit an endpoint in the Kubernetes api that doesn't exist (404). I'm using the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/ea43dfacf8216481ca2f1d9fcf90fc972392a6af>current master kubeflow</denchmark-link> with Kubernetes v1.12 on EKS. I'm running a very simple setup in dedicated VPC, the only caveat is that i'm using dedicated IAM roles as I can't let eksctl create them on-demand unfortunately. Can anyone help me debug the issue? Thanks a lot for this project and thank you in advance for your help! Alessandro

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.84. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Looks like it's better to use a stable version for EKS. I will make some changes and cherry-pick to v0.5-branch. Then I will update documentation to use v0.5-branch later. This will give more stable environment.
I will also check why notebook can not connected on master and come back to you later

Looks like it's better to use a stable version for EKS. I will make some changes and cherry-pick to v0.5-branch. Then I will update documentation to use v0.5-branch later. This will give more stable environment.
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> , thanks for looking into this. The v0.5.1 binary seems broken as it doesn't support the . The v0.5.1 version source seems to have some conflict with Istio and Ambassador, making the ambassador pods continuously crash. I'll open separate issues for those.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/amarrella>@amarrella</denchmark-link> I mean use v0.5-branch kfctl.sh. <denchmark-code>export KUBEFLOW_SRC=/tmp/kubeflow-aws unset KUBEFLOW_TAG # in case you set this env. export KUBEFLOW_VERSION=v0.5-branch mkdir -p ${KUBEFLOW_SRC} && cd ${KUBEFLOW_SRC} curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/${KUBEFLOW_VERSION}/scripts/download.sh | bash </denchmark-code>
And then edit ${KUBEFLOW_SRC}/scripts/aws/util.sh to add following changes before your apply k8s. I will make this PR cherry-picked back to 0.5. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3340/files>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3340/files</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-code>jquery.min.js:2 POST http://xxxx.us-west-2.elb.amazonaws.com/jupyter/api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks 500 (Internal Server Error) </denchmark-code>
I can reproduce this issue in master branch, Let me check what is changed on note book controller side.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/cee39dbcfec7303ac61d3fbb08031acdaec0886f#diff-90e7312f4e78e471ec9f0e7c91db6845>cee39db#diff-90e7312f4e78e471ec9f0e7c91db6845</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zabbasi>@zabbasi</denchmark-link> For aws, we have not integrated with admission-webhook. Could you check if that's why we see 404 for notebooks resources? I check crds and I do see this here.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> if you are using the updated image jupyter-web-app it has dependency to PodDefaults which is installed in admission-webhook componnet. Just check the log of jupyter-web-app to see what the problem is.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/amarrella>@amarrella</denchmark-link> Can you change to elder version temporarily? <denchmark-code>kubectl -n kubeflow edit deployment jupyter-web-app
change image to `gcr.io/kubeflow-dev/jupyter-web-app:v0-43-g810b0b46` </denchmark-code>
Lastest change for PodDefault and AdmissionController is not compatible with current AWS settings

@amarrella I mean use v0.5-branch kfctl.sh. export KUBEFLOW_SRC=/tmp/kubeflow-aws unset KUBEFLOW_TAG # in case you set this env. export KUBEFLOW_VERSION=v0.5-branch mkdir -p ${KUBEFLOW_SRC} && cd ${KUBEFLOW_SRC} curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/${KUBEFLOW_VERSION}/scripts/download.sh | bash And then edit ${KUBEFLOW_SRC}/scripts/aws/util.sh to add following changes before your apply k8s. I will make this PR cherry-picked back to 0.5. https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3340/files
This worked üëç

export KUBEFLOW_VERSION=v0.5-branch
NOT export KUBEFLOW_VERSION=v0.5-branch export KUBEFLOW_VERSION=0.5-branch is right and do curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.5-branch/scripts/download.sh | bash. because in <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.5-branch/scripts/download.sh>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.5-branch/scripts/download.sh</denchmark-link> , character is added.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/graykode>@graykode</denchmark-link> Thanks for pointing this out. I think I unset and didn't figure out this issue. I will file a PR to make the change. in the curl url also need to be parameterized. I will stick to KUBEFLOW_TAG. <denchmark-code>export KUBEFLOW_SRC=/tmp/kubeflow-aws export KUBEFLOW_TAG=v0.5-branch mkdir -p ${KUBEFLOW_SRC} && cd ${KUBEFLOW_SRC} curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/${KUBEFLOW_TAG}/scripts/download.sh | bash </denchmark-code>

Seeing the same issue in a recent on-prem deployment of K8s + Kubeflow. KUBEFLOW_TAG set to v0.5-branch does not help the situation. Any other thoughts? <denchmark-code>$ kubectl -n kubeflow logs jupyter-web-app-864f9cdf8c-jkqkg * Serving Flask app "kubeflow_jupyter.default.app" (lazy loading) * Environment: production WARNING: Do not use the development server in a production environment. Use a production WSGI server instead. * Debug mode: off /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/requests/__init__.py:91: RequestsDependencyWarning: urllib3 (1.25.2) or chardet (3.0.4) doesn't match a supported version! RequestsDependencyWarning) * Running on http://0.0.0.0:5000/ (Press CTRL+C to quit) 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:15] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:15] "GET /static/css/main.css HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:15] "GET /static/css/dialog.css HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:15] "GET /static/js/dialog.js HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:15] "GET /static/js/notebooks.js HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:16] "GET /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:17] "GET /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:18] "GET /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.75.33 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:19] "GET /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.102.170 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:21] "GET /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.102.170 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:23] "GET /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks HTTP/1.1" 200 - 10.233.102.170 - - [11/Jun/2019 01:28:24] "GET /new?namespace=kubeflow HTTP/1.1" 200 - [2019-06-11 01:28:35,200] ERROR in app: Exception on /api/namespaces/kubeflow/notebooks [POST] Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 2292, in wsgi_app response = This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This issue has been fixed by the above PR I filed. We can close this issue. Let me know any issues there. /close

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
In response to this:
This issue has been fixed by the above PR I filed. We can close this issue. Let me know any issues there. /close
Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available here. If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the kubernetes/test-infra repository.
